prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a hollow center. The prism is centered on a white background. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. The hollow center is a perfect sphere with a diameter of 1 unit. The prism is illuminated from the front left corner, casting a soft shadow on the white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles of 0.0 degrees, 0.0 degrees, and -90.0 degrees, and a translation vector of 0.0 units, 0.75 units, and 0.0 units, respectively. Next, create the 2D sketch for the first face of the prism. The sketch will consist of a single loop, with four lines. 1. Create the first line of the loop. The line starts at the point (0.0, 0.0) and ends at the point (0.375, 0.0). 2. Create the second line of the loop. The line starts at the point (0.375, 0.0) and ends at the point (0.375, 0.375). 3. Create the third line of the loop. The line starts at the point (0.375, 0.375) and ends at the point (0.0, 0.375). 4. Create the fourth line of the loop. The line starts at the point (0.0, 0.375) and ends at the point (0.0, 0.0). After completing the 2D sketch, scale the sketch by the scaling parameter of 0.375. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.75 units, while the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0 units. The sketch scaling parameter is set to 0.375. The boolean operation is set to "NewBodyFeatureOperation", which creates a new solid body. The length of the prism is 0.375 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.375 units. The hollow center has a diameter of 1 unit and is not included in the extruded prism. The prism is illuminated from the front left corner, casting a soft shadow on the white background.</description>
